title: Collapse showcase by default
body:
As cool as it is, I personally don't use the showcase tab all that often and would like to have it collapsed by default.
Perhaps a simply entry in `settings.json`?

title: update categories in package.json (#178)
body: This PR fixes Issue #178 and adds gistpad to Data Science, Snippets, and Visualization extension categories.

title: Add gistpad to Data Science and Visualization extension categories
body:
as a vscode marketplace SEO enhancement since this extension ships with some data viz playground gists for data scientists to try.

VSCode v1.48.0 and vscode marketplace now allow to find extensions by category, with new Data Science and Visualization categories added recently. See: https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_48#_extensions-overflow-menu-cleanup

In order to enable this SEO enhancement, we just need to update categories in `package.json`. I would also suggest we add Snippets since gists can be viewed as short code snippets in loose terms.

Proposed changes to `package.json`:

```
"categories": [
    "Data Science",
    "Other",
    "Snippets",
    "Visualization"
  ]
```

What those category filters look like in extensions view panel:

![vega-viewer-data-science](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/656833/90313781-c8b59d80-ded4-11ea-9ed2-f6ac57cac543.png)
``

title: Support for snowpack
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I'd like to use some more exotic packages and currently there's a limited set of packages available through cdnjs. I know you can paste in urls from the likes of jsdelivr and unkpkg but I'm just not sure how to use some packages like this. I think they have to be designed with these services in mind.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
A solution could be to use snowpack which is developed for "Unbundled Development" which is something that gistpad seems to be designed for.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I've tried jsdeliver and unpkg as a possible workaround.

In general really love the approach of Gistpad, it's an amazing and ambitious extension!

title: Feature Request: Copy File "latest" Link
body:
With a Gist, if you remove a particular section of the URI, it will always point to the "latest" file, it would be nice to have the context menu include this option as "Copy Latest URL"
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15258962/89001985-c33f3d00-d2b0-11ea-936d-b7847c604ddb.png)


Example: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/JustinGrote/866536458bfa097cb18a4b82181e5f16/raw/**1b587a334ece5453353529549a726fe3cf392edb**/PoshAnywhere.ps1

Remove the section between the two stars and it will always point to the latest commit, good for install scripts and other items where you want the user to always use the latest version.

title: GitHub API rate limit consumed
body:
GistPad seems to send out a lot of requests to the GitHub API. I'm pretty sure this is causing language server updates for the rust-analyzer extension (which uses a single request to the GitHub API for that) to fail until the rate limit resets.

For example, just loading the extension already sends out 12 requests:
![unknown](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/827762/87963023-637ab200-cab8-11ea-9d2f-90a54c8c8cf7.png)
And it didn't stop there, although I didn't investigate exactly when it sends out more requestsâ€”I assume you know all about that.

I have now signed in, which makes it use the token for its requests and thus bypass rate limits, but this shouldn't have been possible anyway.

**Expected behavior**
Since this seems to be enough to use up the rate limit over time, it'd be nice if it at least warned that that's happening when you're not signed in, or somehow cached the results or perhaps even blocked entirely until signed in?

**Desktop:**
 - VS Code Version v1.47.2
 - GistPad Version v0.1.8

title: version 0.1.8 will suppress string autocompletion in Markdown
body:
**Describe the bug**
When this extension GistPad of version 0.1.8 and/or the extension `:emojisense:` of a recent version is enabled, string autocompletion in Markdown will be suppressed.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

0. Make sure GistPad of version 0.1.8 and `:emojisense:` of any version disabled or uninstalled
1. Enable autocompletion in Markdown with below settings
   ```json
   {
       "editor.quickSuggestions": {
           "comments": true,
           "other": true,
           "strings": true
       },
       "[markdown]": {
           "editor.quickSuggestions": true
       },
   }
   ```
2. Open any Markdown file, and the autocompletion works as the first screenshot shows, where GistPad is of version 0.1.7
3. Install or enable GistPad of version 0.1.8. Alternatively, install or enable `:emojisense:`
4. The autocompletion is now suppressed and broken, like in the second gif screenshot. You can see the string completion is suppressed almost immediately

**Expected behavior**
Autocompletion should remain intact and completions should not be suppressed.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13913131/87871814-42499100-c9e6-11ea-9f40-e4a07ae031ca.png)
![Jul-19-2020 17-39-14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13913131/87872283-aa4da680-c9e9-11ea-8ba1-d75f43b3e547.gif)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

- VS Code Version v1.47.2
- GistPad Version v0.1.8

**Additional context**

1. I rely on autocompletion heavily when writing Markdown
1. Since `:emojisense:` is shipped along with this extension and can also be the culprit, it is mentioned too
3. Annoyingly, the extension "GitHub Pull Requests and Issues" can also be the culprit under some circumstances.

title: Ability to generate a git.io shortURLs for gists
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I have been using gists a lot lately and GistPad helps me manage all that without leaving the editor. I embed these gist URLs in my blog posts and reference them at several places. With the GUIDs embedded into these gist URLs, they tend to be very long. I am, at the moment, using git.io to shorten these urls and then embed into my articles.

title: Add support for inter-wiki links
body:
Currently, GistPad wikis allow you to create [`[[links]]`](https://github.com/vsls-contrib/gistpad#links) amongst markdown pages in the same repo, but there isn't support for defining inter-wiki links. Adding this would allow users to maintain n-number of separate repos and/or have personal/team/community wikis that contain interconnected knowledge (which is super cool!).

As a starting point of view, we could implement support for [inter-wiki links](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interwiki_links), where the wiki identfier is the name of a GitHub repo, or the ID of a gist (e.g. `[[lostintangent/foam-workspace:Todo]]`).

title: Fix gitCredentialFill hanging when it tries to prompt credentials in execSync
body:
**This PR fixes Issue #153**
> The issue mentions Ubuntu  18.04, but I have only tested this on Windows 10. I can setup an Ubuntu machine when I have more time later to confirm this fixes the command on there also, but I don't have access to a MacOS machine that can test this currently.

**Description of the PR**:
This changes `execGitCredentialFill` to set the `GIT_ASKPASS` environment variable to the `askpass-empty.sh` script from the VSCode git extension when calling `execSync`. By making AskPass use `askpass-empty.sh`, the credentials prompt should be skipped when credentials are not set and return an empty string for the the password. So, it should make `execGitCredentialFill` a readonly function instead of getting hung when `git credential fill` tries to ask for credentials.

**Additional context**:
When `git credential fill` is executed and there are not any credentials, it tries to request credentials from the user. Unless the AskPass tool is configured correctly, `execSync` gets stuck when there are no credentials, because it is waiting on input, but `execSync` didn't get any output yet. So they both just sit there waiting on a response from each other, without knowing each other is waiting.

title: Fix git credential fill command
body:
Related to my question in #68, I figured out why this was not working for me. There was a bug in the `git credential fill` input so I removed the leading whitespaces which lead to the command not being properly executed.

When using
```sh
protocol=https
  host=github.com

```
as input for `git credential fill`, it simply queries the first entry in e.g. the macOS keychain that matches `protocol=https`, the `host=github.com` part is simply ignored.

title: CodeTours recorded within Tutorial Playgrounds do not play upon loading Tutorial.
body:
This appears to be due to the way the tour.json file is saved when recording CodeTours, which is in the root folder of the playground. This works for Playgrounds, but not Tutorial Playgrounds. 

Further, this behaviour is different from the Learning MobX Showcase Tutorial which saves a tour.json file within each numbered directory of the Tutorial Playground.

When the recorded CodeTour is altered to contain tour.json files within each step's directory (and the file references appropriately corrected in the tour.json file) the CodeTour plays as expected.

To reproduce:
1. Create a new playground and convert it to a tutorial.
2. Add first step directory and code file, e.g. "1/script.js"
3. Record a CodeTour in "script.js"
4. Reload the Tutorial Playground.

title: Unable to open Gist file with backslash in the filename
body:
**Environment:** 
Windows 10
VSCode 1.42.1
GistPad 0.0.55

**Error Message:**
`Unable to open 'bat.json': Unable to read file 'gist://2ee56db181266c4cb39c4f482e1277e6/snippets\bat.json' (TypeError: Cannot read property 'truncated' of undefined).`

**Steps to Reproduce:**

```
1. Create a text file with some content either locally or directly in the Gist.
2. Refresh GistPad so that the file resides in both locations.
3. Check that you can view the file.

Try steps 4.x or 5.x

4.1 Rename the file locally by adding a backslash to the file name.
4.2 Refresh GistPad.
4.4 Check that the file was updated in the Gist
4.5. Try to view or rename the file locally.

OR

5.1 Rename the file in the Gist by adding a backslash to the file name.
5.2 Refresh GistPad.
5.2 Check that the file was updated locally and is visible in the tree.
5.3. Try to view or rename the file locally.
```

I ran across this today when trying to view a file from a Gist that stores configuration files.  The Gist files are named by prefacing their filename with their path, and on a Windows system that includes a backslash.

If I go into the Gist and change or remove the backslash character it works. If I rename a local file from a Gist by adding a backslash it does rename the file and push it back into the Gist but after that all other attempts to read or rename the file again to remove the backslash fail.

title: ðŸ‘‹ Feedback Wanted: What are you using GistPad for?
body:
Hi! ðŸ‘‹ As part of building out the GistPad experience, weâ€™re very keen to understand what folks are using it for (e.g. maintaining your personal [code snippets](https://twitter.com/marcduiker/status/1206317447483207681?s=21), [collaborating with others](https://twitter.com/uncoded_ls/status/1213975978516586497?s=21), building [interactive playgrounds](https://twitter.com/lostintangent/status/1207718123241033728?s=21), [creating tutorials](https://twitter.com/lostintangent/status/1228780570932498432?s=21) for an online class), to help inform our backlog prioritization, and identify further areas of improvement.

If youâ€™re currently using GistPad (or plan to soon!), it would be extremely helpful if you could share a quick description of your use case, as well as what would be the top thing(s) we could do to improve your workflow. Thanks!

title: Look into interop with Memo
body: [Memo](https://usememo.com) is a note taking app that persists its data to gist. We should also investigate whether thereâ€™s anything needed to ensure GistPad can interoperate with it.

title: Add support for multi-level directories
body: Currently, you can organize your gist files into directories, but only a single-level. The notion of gist directories are meant to extend the value of gists, not to replace repos, and so I'm not too sure how valuable it would be to support multi-level directories. That said, I want to track this limitation in order to get feedback from folks, and help inform the prioritization of this work.

title: Add Geo Data Viewer to Recommended Extensions in docs
Enable debugging for playgrounds

title: Add functionality for viewing forks of Gist
body:
Allows user to right click on a Gist and view all forks, or get an error toast if it hasn't been forked yet.
Fixes https://github.com/vsls-contrib/gistpad/issues/98

Additional todo: 
1. Change Quickpick menu to include username of person who forked the Gist. 
2. Investigate whether it's possible to determine if a given Gist is a fork of another Gist.

title: Allow duplicating gist files
body: Currently, we allow you to duplicate gists, which creates a new gist, seeded with the contents of another gist. Additionally, we allow you to copy the contents of a file from one gist to another (as well as copy local files into gists). However, we donâ€™t provide a one-click way to simply duplicate a file within a gist, much like you can with local files in VS Code. To address this, we should add a â€œDuplicate Fileâ€ command to file nodes in the Gist tree, which will create a new file in the same gist, and using the same contents as the selected file.

title: Allow saving a temporary playground to a gist
body: We just introduced the ability to create a â€œtemporary playgroundâ€, which allows creating playgrounds that arenâ€™t persisted to gists. However, itâ€™s possible that someone would initially create a temporary playground, but then later decide that they want to save it. To support this, we should provide a way to create a Gist from the current temporary playground.

title: Are JavaScript modules compiled or run natively?
body: When creating a new playground with JavaScript modules, it's creating a `.js` files. This usually suggests that the module syntax is bundled or compiled away (e.g. to CommonJS). I tried to rename to `.mjs` but that seems to have broken execution. Is there are way to use uncompiled modules / `.mjs` files?

title: Crate a completion provider for suggesting gist file names in certain file types (e.g. HTML)
body: In order to make it easier to reference relative files within a playgroundâ€™s gist, we should explore registering a completion provider, that suggests the names of other files in the same gist, and is triggered when youâ€™re typing URLs in certain file types (e.g. in HTML files).

title: Allow opening playgrounds from GitHub repos
body: Currently, GistPad operates entirely on Gists as its backing storage. However, more complex playgrounds may benefit from being stored in a repo, since that would allow them to use directories, create PRs, etc. As a result, we should explore extending the â€œOpen Gistâ€ command to accept GitHub repo URLs, in addition to Gist URLs.

title: [wip][playground][refactor]: refactor the playground render piece for reuse
body:
[wip] The PR refactors the code around the rendering of the playground preview with intent to reuse it in the preview server. We need this server for security boundaries in VSO. (and potentially the ability to embed playgrounds or host them e.g. `https://gispad.com/lostintangent/{id}` which should open interesting use case scenarios).

Had to unwrap some circular dependencies so the PR becomes slightly bigger than intended. After refactoring we have the `renderPlaygroundHtml` class that accepts a `gist` and renders the resulting HTML as a string(including adding libraries and transpile code if needed).

title: Add a â€œSplit Bottomâ€ playground layout mode
body: We currently support the following playground layouts: grid, preview, split left, split right and split top. However, we donâ€™t support â€œsplit bottomâ€, where the preview window occupies the bottom half of the editor height, and the three editor windows occupy the top half. In order to provide users and playgrounds with more options, we should provide the â€œsplit bottomâ€ layout as well.

5. Cut and paste from my "old" file to the new one

Preferred workflow:

1. Ctrl-Shift-P
2. Select "Save file as new gist"
3. Pre-populate the file name and only show me the dropdown prompt for what I want the description to be

title: Playground outside auth
body:
This PR adds the ability for new users (who have not signed in) to start a quick playground. The "temp playgrounds" are created under [the gistpad account](https://gist.github.com/gistpad). Once the user signs in, they can fork this temporary playground into their account. The goal is to make it easier for users to try out the playground experience, and then gradually onboard to regular authenticated users.

This PR needs some more work before it can be merged, for example
- [ ] alert user that saving the gist is not saving it to their accounts, and prompt them to sign in
- [ ] one click action to fork when the user signs in
- [x] there's a "description undefined" error that shows up right after the playground is created
- [ ] default templates are not available if the user is not authenticated

I'm creating this WIP PR to see if the implementation seems correct (~there are some state changes involved~, not anymore with the in-memory FS)

(also fyi, depends on #104)

The PR

- adds Gist type icons to the Activity Bar tree for convenience:

- adds the `treeIcons` boolean setting to disable the icons in the tree.

title: Display an MRU list for playground libraries
body: When you add a library to a playground, we currently display the complete, alphabetical list of available libraries. However, itâ€™s likely that users will use the same libraries over and over again, and therefore, we should explore displaying an MRU list at the top of the library list, to allow quickly picking your favorite library, in addition to being able to search for one.

title: Allow creating playgrounds without logging in
body:
In order to create playgrounds, you need to first authenticate with GitHub. This is because playground files are written to gists, and therefore, those gists need to be associated with a specific user.

However, some users may simply want to create ephemeral playgrounds that allow them to explore an idea quickly, and then move on. In these situations, persisting the playground might not be useful, and therefore, needing to sign in could feel a little heavyweight.

To better enable the use of playgrounds, we should explore allowing playground creation, without needing to sign in.

title: [mobx] `observableArray.sort()` error
body:
```js
[mobx] `observableArray.sort()` will not update the array in place. Use `observableArray.slice().sort()` to suppress this warning and perform the operation on a copy, or `observableArray.replace(observableArray.slice().sort())` to sort & update in place (at Proxy.sort (/Users/xxx/.vscode-insiders/extensions/vsls-contrib.gistfs-0.0.43/out/prod/extension.js:88120:21))
```

title: Enable using jsDelivr as the playground library CDN
body: Currently, we allow searching for playground libraries using CDNJS, which provides a fixed set of packages. We should explore using jsDelivr instead, or offering it as an alternative, since it provides an entire reverse proxy on top of NPM, and therefore, would have many more libraries than CDNJS.

title: Allow viewing the forks associated with a gist
body: Currently, there's no way to determine whether a gist was forked from another gist and/or whether a gist has been forked by others. We should explore how to visualize this data in the `Gists` view, so that for example, devs can see who is using their playgrounds/gists as "templates" to explore their own derivations/ideas on top of it.

title: Allow migrating gists to GitHub repos
body: Currently, we allow you to export playgrounds to CodePen, which make it easy to share them with the broader web developer community. Additionally, we allow you to clone a gist locally, which means you could easily create a new repo and push the Gist's code to it. However, in order to make it simpler to "migrate" a gist to a repo (e.g. because you want to work on it with other people, because you want to enable GitHub Pages for static hosting), we should add an `Export to GitHub` command that automatically creates the new repo (or allows you to select an existing one) and handles committing the gist code to it.

title: Add the ability to view the compiled code for playground languages
body: Currently, playgrounds allow you to write TypeScript, Pug, SCSS and Less, and the code is automatically compiled to JavaScript, HTML and CSS on-the-fly. However, in order to enable users to learn new languages and/or see how these preprocessed languages work, we should introduce a way to toggle a view that shows the resulting code when compiling TypeScript, Pug, SCSS and Less.

title: Allow selecting a starred gist when pasting a gist into the editor
body: Currently, we add the `Paste Gist File` command to the editor's context menu, which allows you to quickly paste the contents of a gist file into your open document. However, this command only allows you to select one of your own gists, not a starred gist. As a workaround, you could right-click the starred gist file in the `Gists` explorer and select `Copy File Contents`, but it would be a bit more ergonomic if the `Paste Gist File` command in the editor allowed you to select a starred file directly.

title: Provide an indication of new/unseen gists from followed users
body: When you follow a user, you can see all of their gists, and sort them by updated time. However, we donâ€™t currently provide an indication of gists that are â€œnewâ€ to you, and therefore, make it easier to â€œsubscribeâ€ to a user. This could make it possible to follow online tutorials/classes, and be notified of new material/challenges/etc.

title: Allow starring gists from followed users
body: When you follow a user, we currently allow you to open/clone/fork their gists, but we donâ€™t expose an option to star their gists. This would be really valuable, to enable users to â€œfavoriteâ€ specific gists from users theyâ€™re following, without needing to go to GitHub.com in order to do it.

title: Add a â€œFollow Me in GistPadâ€ deep link/badge
body: GistPad allows users to follow each other, and stay up to date with the gists/playgrounds theyâ€™re building. In order to simplify the following process, and enable devs to advertise their GistPad presence in docs/etc. we should introduce a â€œdeep linkâ€ URL and badge, that allows users to automate the process of launching VS Code and following the respective user.

title: Allow referencing external libraries that are written in other languages
body: GistPad allows you to add external references to script and stylesheet libraries, and it automatically injects them into the preview page. However, it assumes these references point to JavaScript and CSS files, and therefore, doesnâ€™t attempt to compile them before injecting them. In order to support reusable â€œGist templatesâ€, that could include SCSS and TypeScript, we should introduce library compilation, in addition to just playground file compilation.

title: Add support for defining/using SCSS partials/modules
body:
GistPad playgrounds already allow you to use SCSS as your style sheet language, however, your stylesheets canâ€™t currently @import/@use other modules. In order to allow you to define custom partials and then use them in your stylesheets, we should explore defining a [custom module importer](https://sass-lang.com/documentation/js-api#importer) when we compile SCSS.

_Note that the equivalent behavior doesnâ€™t appear to be possible with Pug or TypeScript, so our primary reusability/template story should likely be based around external library references._

title: collapse gist comments by default
body:
showing the comments on gist open could be distractive specially for a long list of comments.

if u want to keep it as dynamic as possible, we can use an option to show/hide them instead.

title: Create new gist\playground if the filesystem url is gist://new or gist://playground.
Detect GitHub Enterprise URL from environment variable
body: Currently, we allow users to specify their GitHub Enterprise URL via a VS Code setting, but we should also allow this to be set via an environment variable, in order to provide better interop with existing tools (e.g. the Hub and [Gist](https://github.com/defunkt/gist) CLIs).

title: Support SSO with the Hub and Gist CLIs
body: Currently, we support SSO with the Git CLI, which enables GistPad to authenticate automatically if the user has already signed in with GitHub and has a token with gist permissions. However, we should also add SSO support for the Hub and [Gist](https://github.com/defunkt/gist) CLIs as well. That way, we can minimize the getting started experience for new users, that may be using other Gist-related tools.

body: Add an abstraction for the sign in flow so that the clicking signin can trigger a browser based auth flow.

title: Re-open playground preview after restarting VS Code
body:
Currently, if you have a playground open and then restart VS Code, the playground files (e.g. index.html) and WebView remain open, but the preview window isnâ€™t properly hooked up. As a result, the user has to re-open the playground in order to start working on it again.

To make this experience smoother, we should detect the restart and then re-initialize the playground automatically.

title: Allow pasting images into HTML files
body: We currently contribute the â€œPaste Screenshotâ€ command, to make it easy to upload/insert images from your clipboard and into markdown files. However, to improve the playground experience, we should also allow this command to be run in HTML files, so that local images can be easily used in playgrounds, without the user needing to manually upload it to the Gist or an image hosting service.

title: Add support for other playground languages
body:
Currently, you can create playgrounds using the following languages: HTML/Pug, CSS/SCSS/Less, and JavaScript/TypeScript. In all cases, the code is compiled as needed, as you type, without the user needing to do anything. This makes it really easy to visually iterate on code, using whichever languages youâ€™re most productive with.

In order to continue supporting other developer preferences, Iâ€™d love to hear feedback about which additional languages would be useful to have. For example: [Stylus](https://codepen.io/jh3y/pen/rNawvYm), [Haml](https://codepen.io/vcurd/pen/VwYbEom), Elm, PureScript, Vue single file components, Svelte, etc. Iâ€™ll also continue to survey the CodePen ecosystem to see what folks are using in practice, to make sure that GistPad playgrounds provide strong interop with the community.

title: Allow specifying external stylesheet references in playground.json
body: Currently, you can add playground references to external JavaScript libraries, by adding them to the â€œlibrariesâ€ property of the playgroundâ€™s playground.json manifest file. However, we should also allow specifying external stylesheet references as well, via a new â€œstylesâ€ (or â€œstylesheetsâ€?) property. Just like the existing libraries support, we should also enable a rich integration with CDNJS so that itâ€™s easy to add commonly used stylsheets (e.g. font awesome).

title: Add a â€œSend to CodePenâ€ command for exporting playgrounds
body: We currently allow opening pens that have been exported to Gists, and to complete the CodePen interop, we should add a way to â€œexportâ€ a GistPad playground to a CodePen pen. Theyâ€™ve already got the [API](https://blog.codepen.io/documentation/api/prefill/) for this, and it would enable devs to work on a playground locally, and then â€œmigrateâ€ it to CodePen for sharing.

title: [editor]: add `Paste Screenshot` command
body: The PR: 1. Implements `Paste Screenshot` command (using abstractions infrastructure in anticipation of the serverless experience). By default, the screenshot is uploaded to the gist as a `.png` file: ![paste-screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1478800/70382701-9a7ac980-1914-11ea-9fb0-6e55424e2e54.gif) 2. Contributes settings: - Contributes the `Gistpad: Paste Screenshot Type` setting that alters the behaviour to `base64`-embed the screenshot instead of uploading as a file. - Contributes the `Gistpad: Paste Screenshot Output` setting that allows switching between `Markdown`(default)/`HTML` for image markup (e.g. `![img](link)` vs ``). 3. Adds the `super + shift + v` command for the command above. 3. Adds the `Paste Screenshot` context menu item.

title: This extension conflicts with the GitHub Gist Explorer extension.
body: According to my observations, if this extension is installed together with the extension GitHub Gist Explorer (k9982874.github-gist-explorer, https://github.com/k9982874/github-gist-explorer), then this causes the removal of the GitHub Gist Explorer. If you perform operations with gist using the GistPad extension and then restart VS Code, then GitHub Gist Explorer will be deleted. Apparently at the moment, these expansions are incompatible and cannot be installed together. Link to this problem: https://github.com/k9982874/github-gist-explorer/issues/21 .

title: Rendering Jupyter notebooks by default when opening a Gist
body: Example: https://gist.github.com/danyalahmed247/cb6feecbfc0d342fdd070c803a2c33fb

title: Add better error handling when the user provides an invalid/expired token
List gists for authenticated user
body:
Adds a command to list gists. Closes #2.

(Also contains a version bump in package-lock.json, corresponding to this: https://github.com/vsls-contrib/gist-fs/commit/509071f55d9a0c4fc1f713c5e93af9283be92344#diff-b9cfc7f2cdf78a7f4b91a753d10865a2)

title: Allow specifying multiple files when creating a Gist
body: When you create a Gist, we currently allow you to specify the name of the file to seed it with. However, in order to simplify the process of creating multi-file Gists, we should allow users to specify a comma-separated list of file names to seed the new Gist with.

title: Allow opening/creating a Gist within the current workspace
body: Currently, when you create/open a Gist, we open it as a new virtual workspace. This reloads VS Code, and prevents you from being able to easily work on a Gist alongside of another project. To address this, we should add an option to open/create a Gist as a series of â€œloose filesâ€â€™within the current VS Code instance (without needing to reload).

title: Add Gist management view
body: In addition to allowing you to list your gists via #2, we should also add a tree view to easily manage your Gists visually (add/delete/open/star).

title: Cannot open Gists: Cannot read property 'files' of undefined
body:
Hi there,

Great extension but doesn't work for me. When trying to open an existing Gist, I get this error

Unable to open '5cee0b498a71a39698c06fb95341xxxx': Unable to read file (TypeError: Cannot read property 'files' of undefined).

title: "org.freedesktop.secrets was not provided by any .service files" when doing GistFS: New Gist for the first time
body:
After successfully installed GistFS from the market place, when the "GistFS: New Gist" command was run for the first time, VSCode prompted me with the following error message:
`org.freedesktop.secrets was not provided by any .service files`

After some googling, install the following package on my system solved it:
_gnome-keyring_

Perhaps it would help to include some pointer in the Getting Started section of the document / webpage that gnome-keyring is a dependency?

title: Allow creating secret Gists
body: Gists can be either public or secret. Many times, I want to create a secret Gist. It would be great if there was a command to create a secret Gist.

title: Ability to Group Github Gists
body:
Github Gist does not support folders. However, we can consider setting tags in the description of a Gist, which could be used to create a grouping in vscode.

An application like lepton appends `#thistag` to the description of the gist.

Suggestions:
Option 1: use [#tag1, #tag2] at the beginning of the description
Option 1: use #thistag1 appended at the end of the description of a gist

title: Introduce the notion of Gist â€œtemplatesâ€ to allow quickly creating new Gists
Prompt the user to fork, when they try to edit a Gist they donâ€™t own
body: When you attempt to edit a Gist, we currently prompt you to authenticate if you havenâ€™t already. However, if the currently opened Gist isnâ€™t yours, then you wonâ€™t be able to edit it, regardless if youâ€™re signed in or not. In order to make this flow more user-friendly, we should automatically detect it, and ask the user if theyâ€™d like to fork the currently opened Gist.

title: Allow listing your starred gists
body: Related to #2, but would present the list of Gists youâ€™ve starred, not the ones youâ€™ve created.

title: Allow listing your Gists
body: Instead of just creating a new gist, or opening one by ID, we should add a command to allow users to view all of their current Gists and then open one. That way, you donâ€™t need to retrieve the Gist ID from the browser before you can begin editing it in VS Code.

title: Add a â€œOpen in environmentâ€ command
body: Behind the scenes, a Gist is simply a GitHub repo, and therefore, we could enable â€œupgradingâ€ from an editable Gist, to a fully compute-backed environment in VSO. This would allow running, debugging, etc. the code in the Gist, which might be valuable for quickly experimenting with some prototype/shared code.

title: bug: Zooming the VS Code interface scales the preview window too
body:
Zooming the VS Code window using `Ctrl+=` or `Ctrl+-` to increase the general interface scale also scales up the preview window. (Ext v0.0.16 on v1.55.2 on Linux).

In retrospect, this might seem obvious, but I think the biggest issue is that the VS Code Interface doesn't mention that it's been zoomed in/out. I've been caught off guard with the actual website turning out to be a scaled version of what I expect.

Ideas on possible fixes:
 - Have a setting that allows you to keep the preview window at 100% regardless of your VS Code scaling (but does anyone really need a scaled version of a website you're prototyping?)
 - If it's not possible to change the preview window scale separately from the interface scale, maybe there can be a warning on the console warning the user that the interface has been scaled, so they aren't caught off-guard.

I've said this before, thank you for this amazing extension!

title: Request: LESS/SASS Preview Output
body: I know that CodeSwing supports LESS and SASS, would it be possible to show a preview of the output? Similar to the way that CodePen lets you toggle to view the compiled output.

title: [Request] - Debugger integration
body:
As the Swings can contain JS, it would be nice to have VSCode's debugger integrate with the script you add. This would allow users to set breakpoints on the `script.js` file and hit debug on the side bar.

A naive approach to this working would be to add a `.vscode/launch.json` file to the temp folder, but maybe there's better ways

title: Quick iteration workflow: duplicate Swing, make changes, save, repeat
body:
Maybe I'm missing something but right now it seems that browsing CodeSwings isn't possible and you have to open the directory and can only have one swing open at a time. Is this correct?

When learning a new framework or language I think a great way to iterate quickly is to move from one example to the next (which is also how documentation tends to do it).

To get a smooth UX for quick iteration I think the following are necessary

- duplicate current swing (and make the duplicated one the new active Swing)
- automatically suggest a name (maybe just the time of the day) but also allow to easily rename
- display a list of Swings so the user can go back and forth between iterations quickly

If there's a better way already, please let me know. Otherwise I'm also interested in helping implement this but I'd probably need some assistance.

title: Confusing UX when in an existing project
body:
If a user creates a new swing in an existing project, it is a bit visually confusing as to what is going on:

1. The Explorer panel for the existing project is still open on the left
2. If the user created the swing in a different folder, there is no reference to the current swing file (eg. `index.jsx`) in the Explorer panel

Maybe it would make sense to open a new window with the location of the created swing?

Some other strange-feeling behaviors:

3. You can close the Swing file without the preview tab closing. There could be a UI state where you have the old preview tab still around, but unrelated files in the existing project open.
4. If you close the preview tab, it closes all other files (also unrelated ones)
5. If you start a new Swing in an existing project with some files open, it will try to close those files (and lead to confusing, seemingly unrelated warnings such as `Are you sure that you want to close <unrelated buffer tab X>?`

Maybe these would also be addressed by opening swings in their own windows.

title: Simpler UX for Creating Swings
body:
For the first creation of a playground / sandbox environment, it would be nice to be able to reduce the cognitive effort required to get to a working, running Swing.

Right now, these are the steps:

1. <kbd>cmd</kbd>-<kbd>shift</kbd>-<kbd>p</kbd> -> `CodeSwing: New Swing...`
2. Get thrown into a file selection window, which is confusing and distracting, figure out that you need to choose a folder for the files to go
3. Create a new folder in this dialog, with no good suggestion for a default folder name ("untitled folder" is the default on macOS)
4. Get a long list of options that the user needs to choose from (if the user <kbd>cmd</kbd>-<kbd>tab</kbd>s away from VS Code, this disappears, leaving the empty folder behind)
5. Choose one of these options
6. Start coding

In this amount of time, it is pretty easy to forget that little idea that you wanted to try out.

For comparison, let's look at CodeSandbox:

1. Visit https://codesandbox.io/s/new?file=/src/App.js
2. Start coding

Suggestion 1: Here's a suggestion for a possible workflow:

1. <kbd>cmd</kbd>-<kbd>shift</kbd>-<kbd>p</kbd> -> `CodeSwing: New Swing...`. This will automatically create a folder with an auto-generated name to hold the Swing files within some VS Code directory, which can be customized afterwards if the user wants.
2. Get a long list of options that the user needs to choose from (this stays, even when user <kbd>cmd</kbd>-<kbd>tab</kbd>s away from VS Code). The last-used templates are listed at the top in reverse-chronological order.
3. Choose from the list of templates
4. Start coding

Suggestion 2: And something even faster, for those who know what they want:

1. <kbd>cmd</kbd>-<kbd>shift</kbd>-<kbd>p</kbd> -> `CodeSwing: New Swing with Last Template`. This will automatically create a folder with an auto-generated name to hold the Swing files within some VS Code directory, which can be customized afterwards if the user wants. It will use the last-used template that the user chose.
2. Start coding

title: [request] - Use "build" shortcut to "Run Swing" if codeswing is open
body:
VSCode has pre-defined shortcuts for build.  This means it's already natural for users to run this when they want to execute a script or start building something they've put together. It's a good match for CodeSwing to bind this to "Run Swing".

On MacOS its:
```json
{
  "key": "shift+cmd+b",
  "command": "workbench.action.tasks.build"
}
```

It would be good to make use of this when inside a codeswing to run the code (or hit "run swing" effectively). As users are already familiar with this it would be more intuitive (rather than making a new shortcut).
In order to not be disruptive to existing workflows it can only be active when a codeswing is open, this way it's only overridden when someone is actively using codeswing and not all the time.

title: Intellisense of imported libraries
body:
Hey great extension. This is a good way to try out/play with new libraries.

This may be a long shot but worth asking.
Is it technically possible to get completions for libraries added in the "script.js" pane? I can imagine this isn't easy but would be awesome if doable.

So "jQuery" for example. Its added in my "scripts" array. Can definitions be pull down on the fly and used by VSCode? 

## Automatic Type Acquisition
We can rely on VSCodes  [Automatic Type Acquisition](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/nodejs/working-with-javascript#_typings-and-automatic-type-acquisition) it sounds like we can force this in a jsconfig.json file and VSCode does the rest. Just auto generate the file and place it in the same directory as the script.js. Below ive done it manually.

Before:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/936006/106065197-d95c7780-60f2-11eb-8591-33fc4df2cd8d.png)

Then in the same folder I add `jsconfig.json`
```
{
  "typeAcquisition": {
    "include": ["jquery"]
  }
}
```

After:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/936006/106065253-f2fdbf00-60f2-11eb-9b15-0bdf1ca39dc5.png)

That works well!
The only downside here is we can't force a specific version. I think VSCode just grabs the latest.

> Automatic type acquisition will always download the declaration file for the latest version of a library. If you're using a different version, there may be mismatches between what's shown in Intellisense and what's actually available at runtime
_https://ticehurst.com/jsdocs/articles/types/ata.html_

## skypack 
I just found that Skypack supports typescript declarations in its CDN. It sends the path in its header response. More info here:
https://docs.skypack.dev/skypack-cdn/api-reference/lookup-urls#typescript-declarations

jQuery: https://cdn.skypack.dev/jquery
jQuery Type: https://cdn.skypack.dev/-/jquery@v3.5.1-GJsJJ2VEWnBDZuot9fRf/dist=es2020,mode=types/index.d.ts

I'm not sure how easy it is to traverse those types and download them

It would also be nice to point directly to type declarations but I don't think that's possible right now.
https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/28985 might be a blocker

@FredKSchott  can Skypack/Snowpack be utilised here in anyway?

Other ideas:
Auto generating something like this https://dev.to/patarapolw/cdn-and-typescript-support-also-javascript-typing-for-ide-1bko, adding a package.json, then

There's also https://github.com/tokilabs/autotypes

title: CodeTour inside of codeswing uses incorrect subdirectories
body:
**Current behavior:**
When a new CodeTour is recorded inside of a nested CodeSwing saved within a subdirectory of a workspace, the tour file assumes that all paths are relative to the directory root and not the CodeSwing root or the "main.tour" file location.

This seems to only happen in multi-step CodeSwing (with each step inside a subdirectory). 

**Expected behavior:**
Either the tour file's location in the workspace directory structure should be used to determine the location of the files in the tour (thus making it more portable when moving the tour and respective files) or CodeSwing's "record tour" feature should add the relative location of the file with respect to the root of the workspace (and not the root of the codeswing) in order to match the expected input for CodeTour.

**Steps to reproduce:**

- Create a new CodeSwing in a subdirectory with either multiple steps or with subdirectories.
- Record a codetour, annotating the files.
- The resulting codetour file describes file locations relative to the root of the codeswing.json file, not the workspace.
- Play the CodeTour. Error from not being able to find the file results.

**Workaround**
None at this time.

It seems like the posted message is getting stopped in an iframe that is sitting between VS Code and the sandbox that runs the tutorial advance header. Perhaps it should be forwarded?

title: Optimize extension activation
body:
Hey this extension looks great!

For [activationEvents](https://github.com/codespaces-contrib/codeswing/blob/main/package.json#L23) try to avoid using `*`. Using `*` means this extension will startup and activate even if someone is not using it. It will also incur a (albeit small) startup cost for users.

As this extension seems to be command driven you can put the commands in there instead, that way it won't slow down performance when not in use. More info here:
https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/activation-events#Start-up

> If you open a directory in VS Code, and that directory represents a swing, then the swing environment will be automatically launched. 

I'm not sure how you detect this but you can have the extension activate if a certain file is in the workspace (there's an example of that [here](https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/blob/master/editors/code/package.json#L66)) or if there's really other option `onStartupFinished` may be better

title: Enable easily publishing swing previews to GitHub Pages
body:
While CodeSwing supports exporting your swings to CodePen, it would be ideal if there were a way to share a swing preview with others, without needing to rely on another service.

Since it's likely that many users will store/version their swings in a GitHub repo, we should explore how to make it easier to "publish" swings to a repo, and then host them via GitHub Pages.

title: Tweaks to Custom Languages section of the README
body:
The README does not explain the contribution language extension point clearly, and references features that do not exist.

I updated it to match what is in the code, which should be extended when those features are added.

title: Using codeswing to support a LED display emulator
body:
Hi there,

Firstly thanks for your work here! This project is _very_ close to what I've been looking for as I try build out an editor for some of my LED projects. Since uploading to the wall takes ~30 seconds having the emulator makes it much easier to build out patterns. Here's an example one I built for the new year: https://www.facebook.com/509819936/videos/10160610832109937/

I managed to get everything hacked together and working in CodeSwing. The code (both a swing and the extension that implements `codeSwingCompile`) is here: https://github.com/qix/light-swing

It required a bit of reverse engineering since there were no actual examples and the documentation was often misleading. I'll send a pull request with some tweaks there, but an example extension would be super handy as well.

In order to make this really great I have two feature requests that are intertwined. I'd be happy to help work on them but realize it may be quite a deviation from your plans so would be worthwhile to have a discussion first:

a) Support for multiple files.
At the very least for this project I would like two files. The lighting script (which is currently the `index.ino` file) and the coordinates of the LED lights (which is currently hard-coded into the extension, `src/points.ts`). Since these two files would need to be combined to form the output page the current API for `codeSwingCompile` would not work. I _might_ be able to hack it having the `points` file compile down to CSS, but that's not really ideal.

b) Support for `codeSwingCompile` inside the swing
This one is not as major if you're strongly opposed, but I would much rather have my instructions be *Install the codeswing extension* and *open this workspace*. The actual `light-swing` parsing and compilation would be put into a normal JS package, which `codeswing.json` might reference.

I'd imagine the API to be:
`codeSwingCompile(files: { filename: source }): { html, css, script, input }`. That API would also allow multiple input `.ino` and `.h` files. If everything matches what is already displayed only the `checkInput` method is called. Since this is an advanced use case obviously some of the other features such as CodePen export would no longer work.

Thanks again! Let me know your thoughts.

title: Allow adding/deleting/renaming files from the tree view
body: In order to make scratch swings more usable, we need to allow users to add/delete/rename files. Since we already expose the CodeSwing tree while you're in a swing, that would be the natural place to enable it.

title: Support window.confirm/prompt
body: The VS Code WebView disallows calling these APIs, and so we'll need to "monkey patch" them inside the swing preview and then virtualize them into VS Code toasts/input boxes.

title: Support window.open
body: The VS Code WebView disallows calling `window.open`, and so we'll need to virtualize calls to this API, by opening new WebView windows.

title: CodeSwing preview does not update with setting onEdit
body:
Hi, thanks for creating this extension! I've just added the latest version 0.0.5 to my local VSCode, and it does not seem to update the preview upon editing. 

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open VSCode
2. Ctrl+Shift+P to open command
3. Select 'CodeSwing > New Swing...'
4. Select folder to save in
5. Type 'Hello World' in `index.html`

I also noted that it doesn't update the preview on saving. However, I was able to get the preview to update by changing the layout setting by selecting 'Change Layout' and then selecting any layout from the dropdown.

If it helps, here's the details about my setup:

Version: 1.52.1 (system setup)
Commit: ea3859d4ba2f3e577a159bc91e3074c5d85c0523
Date: 2020-12-16T16:34:46.910Z
Electron: 9.3.5
Chrome: 83.0.4103.122
Node.js: 12.14.1
V8: 8.3.110.13-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.19041

The extension settings are set to the defaults. 

Let me know if there is anything else you'd need from me to debug this. Thanks again, this extension looks great overall.

title: Support other languages (e.g. Go, Rust, C#)
body: Currently, CodeSwing supports web-based languages, but depending on user-interest, it would make sense to add support for other languages as well. If folks are finding CodeSwing useful, and are interested in another language, I'd love to hear that feedback!

title: Allow exporting a swing to CodePen
Display an MRU for libraries
body: When you add a library to a swing, we currently display the complete, alphabetical list of available libraries. However, itâ€™s likely that users will use the same libraries over and over again, and therefore, we should explore displaying an MRU list at the top of the library list, to allow quickly picking your favorite library, in addition to being able to search for one.

title: Enable using Skypack and jsDelivr for libraries
body: Currently, we allow searching for swing libraries using CDNJS, which provides a fixed set of packages. We should explore using jsDelivr or Skypack instead, or offering it as an alternative, since it provides an entire reverse proxy on top of NPM, and therefore, would have many more libraries than CDNJS.

title: Allow viewing the generated code for compiled languages
body: Currently, swings allow you to write TypeScript, Pug, SCSS and Less, and the code is automatically compiled to JavaScript, HTML and CSS on-the-fly. However, in order to enable users to learn new languages and/or see how these preprocessed languages work, we should introduce a way to toggle a view that shows the resulting code when compiling TypeScript, Pug, SCSS and Less.

title: Re-open preview window for "Scratch" swings after reloading VS Code
body:
Currently, if you have a swing open and then restart VS Code, the swing files (e.g. index.html) and WebView remain open, but the preview window isnâ€™t properly hooked up. As a result, the user has to re-open the swing in order to start working on it again.

To make this experience smoother, we should detect the restart and then re-initialize the swing automatically.

title: "Open CodeSwing" status bar button
body: We should add an `Open CodeSwing` button to the status bar whenever the current workspace is a CodeSwing, and the swing isn't active. That way, there's an easy way to re-open the swing without needing to reload VS Code/Codespaces.

title: Live Share integration
body: When a guest joins a session, and the host is in a CodeSwing workspace, we should automatically open the swing. Additionally, we should synchronize layout changes and swing runs, so that all participants share the same swing state.

title: Updating guzzle dependancy to fix a dependancy collision issue
body: The package smugmug-embed leverages your package, but the guzzle 6.2 dependency is causing a dependency collision by updating to the newer 6.5.5 version, the issue is resolved.

title: Saving/Reusing the Token
body:
Hello,

I am looking at the oAuth example and trying to use this so I don't have to constantly login every time I go to a new page:

`$options = [

                $client = new phpSmug\Client($APIKey, $options);
                $client->setToken($_SESSION['token'], $_SESSION['tokensecret']);
`
but I get this error message:

_An OAuthSecret is required for all SmugMug OAuth interactions. (Error Code: 0)_

The session variables and other variable I am using are populated.

I am sure I am missing some basic concept...I just don't know what I don't know and I have searched all over to figure it out without having to bother someone about it. Would you please let me know what I am doing wrong?

Thanks,
Matt

A few misc updates which don't affect the functionality:

- Fix site links
- Update site gems to address security alerts
- Make it clear in `example.php` when no public albums are found rather than failing badly
- Enforce minimum PHP version of 7.3
- Move CI to GitHub Actions

title: Bump nokogiri from 1.10.9 to 1.11.1 in /docs
body:
Bumps [nokogiri](https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri) from 1.10.9 to 1.11.1.
Release notes

Sourced from nokogiri's releases.

v1.11.1 / 2021-01-06

Fixed

  • [CRuby] If libxml-ruby is loaded before nokogiri, the SAX and Push parsers no longer call libxml-ruby's handlers. Instead, they defensively override the libxml2 global handler before parsing. [#2168]

SHA-256 Checksums of published gems

f760285e3db732ee0d6e06370f89407f656d5181a55329271760e82658b4c3fc  nokogiri-1.11.1-x64-mingw32.gem
dd48343bc4628936d371ba7256c4f74513b6fa642e553ad7401ce0d9b8d26e1f  nokogiri-1.11.1-x86-linux.gem
7f49138821d714fe2c5d040dda4af24199ae207960bf6aad4a61483f896bb046  nokogiri-1.11.1-x86-mingw32.gem
5c26111f7f26831508cc5234e273afd93f43fbbfd0dcae5394490038b88d28e7  nokogiri-1.11.1-x86_64-darwin.gem
c3617c0680af1dd9fda5c0fd7d72a0da68b422c0c0b4cebcd7c45ff5082ea6d2  nokogiri-1.11.1-x86_64-linux.gem
42c2a54dd3ef03ef2543177bee3b5308313214e99f0d1aa85f984324329e5caa  nokogiri-1.11.1.gem

v1.11.0 / 2021-01-03

Notes

Faster, more reliable installation: Native Gems for Linux and OSX/Darwin

"Native gems" contain pre-compiled libraries for a specific machine architecture. On supported platforms, this removes the need for compiling the C extension and the packaged libraries. This results in much faster installation and more reliable installation, which as you probably know are the biggest headaches for Nokogiri users.

We've been shipping native Windows gems since 2009, but starting in v1.11.0 we are also shipping native gems for these platforms:

  • Linux: x86-linux and x86_64-linux -- including musl platforms like alpine
  • OSX/Darwin: x86_64-darwin and arm64-darwin

We'd appreciate your thoughts and feedback on this work at #2075.

Dependencies

Ruby

This release introduces support for Ruby 2.7 and 3.0 in the precompiled native gems.

This release ends support for:

  • Ruby 2.3, for which official support ended on 2019-03-31 [#1886] (Thanks @ashmaroli!)
  • Ruby 2.4, for which official support ended on 2020-04-05
  • JRuby 9.1, which is the Ruby 2.3-compatible release.

Gems

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from nokogiri's changelog.

v1.11.1 / 2021-01-06

Fixed

  • [CRuby] If libxml-ruby is loaded before nokogiri, the SAX and Push parsers no longer call libxml-ruby's handlers. Instead, they defensively override the libxml2 global handler before parsing. [#2168]

v1.11.0 / 2021-01-03

Notes

Faster, more reliable installation: Native Gems for Linux and OSX/Darwin

"Native gems" contain pre-compiled libraries for a specific machine architecture. On supported platforms, this removes the need for compiling the C extension and the packaged libraries. This results in much faster installation and more reliable installation, which as you probably know are the biggest headaches for Nokogiri users.

We've been shipping native Windows gems since 2009, but starting in v1.11.0 we are also shipping native gems for these platforms:

  • Linux: x86-linux and x86_64-linux -- including musl platforms like alpine
  • OSX/Darwin: x86_64-darwin and arm64-darwin

We'd appreciate your thoughts and feedback on this work at #2075.

Dependencies

Ruby

This release introduces support for Ruby 2.7 and 3.0 in the precompiled native gems.

This release ends support for:

  • Ruby 2.3, for which official support ended on 2019-03-31 [#1886] (Thanks @ashmaroli!)
  • Ruby 2.4, for which official support ended on 2020-04-05
  • JRuby 9.1, which is the Ruby 2.3-compatible release.

Gems

  • Explicitly add racc as a runtime dependency. [#1988] (Thanks, @voxik!)
  • [MRI] Upgrade mini_portile2 dependency from ~> 2.4.0 to ~> 2.5.0 [#2005] (Thanks, @alejandroperea!)

Security

See note below about CVE-2020-26247 in the "Changed" subsection entitled "XML::Schema parsing treats input as untrusted by default".

Added

  • Add Node methods for manipulating "keyword attributes" (for example, class and rel): #kwattr_values, #kwattr_add, #kwattr_append, and #kwattr_remove. [#2000]

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 7be6f04 version bump to v1.11.1
  • aa0c399 dev: overhaul .gitignore
  • 3d90c6d Merge pull request #2169 from sparklemotion/2168-active-support-test-failure
  • bbf850c changelog: update for #2168
  • ee69772 ci: another valgrind suppression
  • f9a2c4e fix: restore proper error handling in the SAX push parser
  • 35aa88b fix(cruby): reset libxml2's error handler in sax and push parsers
  • 07459fd fix(test): clobber libxml2's global error handler before every test
  • b682ac5 ci: ensure all tests are running setup
  • 007662f github: update "installation difficulty" issue template
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Bump rubyzip from 1.2.2 to 2.3.0 in /docs
body:
Bumps [rubyzip](https://github.com/rubyzip/rubyzip) from 1.2.2 to 2.3.0.
Release notes

Sourced from rubyzip's releases.

v2.3.0

  • Fix frozen string literal error #431
  • Set OutputStream.write_buffer's buffer to binmode #439
  • Upgrade rubocop and fix various linting complaints #437 #440

Tooling:

  • Add a bin/console script for development #420
  • Update rake requirement (development dependency only) to fix a security alert.

v2.2.0

  • Add support for decompression plugin gems #427

v2.1.0

  • Fix (at least partially) the restore_times and restore_permissions options to Zip::File.new #413
    • Previously, neither option did anything, regardless of what it was set to. We have therefore defaulted them to false to preserve the current behavior, for the time being. If you have explicitly set either to true, it will now have an effect.
    • Fix handling of UniversalTime (mtime, atime, ctime) fields. #421
    • Previously, Zip::File did not pass the options to Zip::Entry in some cases. #423
    • Note that restore_times in this release does nothing on Windows and only restores mtime, not atime or ctime.
  • Allow Zip::File.open to take an options hash like Zip::File.new #418
  • Always print warnings with warn, instead of a mix of puts and warn #416
  • Create temporary files in the system temporary directory instead of the directory of the zip file #411
  • Drop unused tmpdir requirement #411

Tooling

  • Move CI to xenial and include jruby on JDK11 #419

v2.0.0

Security

  • Default the validate_entry_sizes option to true, so that callers can trust an entry's reported size when using extract #403
    • This option defaulted to false in 1.3.0 for backward compatibility, but it now defaults to true. If you are using an older version of ruby and can't yet upgrade to 2.x, you can still use 1.3.0 and set the option to true.

Tooling / Documentation

  • Remove test files from the gem to avoid problems with antivirus detections on the test files #405 / #384
  • Drop support for unsupported ruby versions #406

v1.3.0

Security

  • Add validate_entry_sizes option so that callers can trust an entry's reported size when using extract #403
    • This option defaults to false for backward compatibility in this release, but you are strongly encouraged to set it to true. It will default to true in rubyzip 2.0.

New Feature

  • Add add_stored method to simplify adding entries without compression #366

Tooling / Documentation

... (truncated)
Changelog

Sourced from rubyzip's changelog.

2.3.0 (2020-03-14)

  • Fix frozen string literal error #431
  • Set OutputStream.write_buffer's buffer to binmode #439
  • Upgrade rubocop and fix various linting complaints #437 #440

Tooling:

  • Add a bin/console script for development #420
  • Update rake requirement (development dependency only) to fix a security alert.

2.2.0 (2020-02-01)

  • Add support for decompression plugin gems #427

2.1.0 (2020-01-25)

  • Fix (at least partially) the restore_times and restore_permissions options to Zip::File.new #413
    • Previously, neither option did anything, regardless of what it was set to. We have therefore defaulted them to false to preserve the current behavior, for the time being. If you have explicitly set either to true, it will now have an effect.
    • Fix handling of UniversalTime (mtime, atime, ctime) fields. #421
    • Previously, Zip::File did not pass the options to Zip::Entry in some cases. #423
    • Note that restore_times in this release does nothing on Windows and only restores mtime, not atime or ctime.
  • Allow Zip::File.open to take an options hash like Zip::File.new #418
  • Always print warnings with warn, instead of a mix of puts and warn #416
  • Create temporary files in the system temporary directory instead of the directory of the zip file #411
  • Drop unused tmpdir requirement #411

Tooling

  • Move CI to xenial and include jruby on JDK11 #419

2.0.0 (2019-09-25)

Security

  • Default the validate_entry_sizes option to true, so that callers can trust an entry's reported size when using extract #403
    • This option defaulted to false in 1.3.0 for backward compatibility, but it now defaults to true. If you are using an older version of ruby and can't yet upgrade to 2.x, you can still use 1.3.0 and set the option to true.

Tooling / Documentation

  • Remove test files from the gem to avoid problems with antivirus detections on the test files #405 / #384
  • Drop support for unsupported ruby versions #406

1.3.0 (2019-09-25)

Security

  • Add validate_entry_sizes option so that callers can trust an entry's reported size when using extract #403
    • This option defaults to false for backward compatibility in this release, but you are strongly encouraged to set it to true. It will default to true in rubyzip 2.0.
... (truncated)

title: Bump nokogiri from 1.8.4 to 1.10.9 in /docs
body:
Bumps [nokogiri](https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri) from 1.8.4 to 1.10.9.
Release notes

Sourced from nokogiri's releases.

1.10.9 / 2020-03-01

Fixed

  • [MRI] Raise an exception when Nokogiri detects a specific libxml2 edge case involving blank Schema nodes wrapped by Ruby objects that would cause a segfault. Currently no fix is available upstream, so we're preventing a dangerous operation and informing users to code around it if possible. [#1985, #2001]
  • [JRuby] Change NodeSet#to_a to return a RubyArray instead of Object, for compilation under JRuby 9.2.9 and later. [#1968, #1969] (Thanks, @headius!)

1.10.8 / 2020-02-10

Security

[MRI] Pulled in upstream patch from libxml that addresses CVE-2020-7595. Full details are available in #1992. Note that this patch is not yet (as of 2020-02-10) in an upstream release of libxml.

1.10.7 / 2019-12-03

Bug

  • [MRI] Ensure the patch applied in v1.10.6 works with GNU patch. #1954

1.10.6 / 2019-12-03

Bug

  • [MRI] Fix FreeBSD installation of vendored libxml2. [#1941, #1953] (Thanks, @nurse!)

1.10.5 / 2019-10-31

Dependencies

  • [MRI] vendored libxml2 is updated from 2.9.9 to 2.9.10
  • [MRI] vendored libxslt is updated from 1.1.33 to 1.1.34

1.10.4 / 2019-08-11

Security

Address CVE-2019-5477 (#1915)

A command injection vulnerability in Nokogiri v1.10.3 and earlier allows commands to be executed in a subprocess by Ruby's Kernel.open method. Processes are vulnerable only if the undocumented method Nokogiri::CSS::Tokenizer#load_file is being passed untrusted user input.

title: 404 returned just for our Smugmug site album list
body:
I don't know whether this is something anyone has seen before or can provide any advice about, but I am at my wits' end because it seems to make no sense at all.

Our app, which was working fine for most of the year up to last week, now refuses to play due to a 404 error when trying to access /user/ouraccount!albums

Bizarrely:
    - if I change ouraccount in the above to a different Smugmug account, it works;
    - if I change !albums to another endpoint like !featuredalbums, I get no 404; and
    - if I copy the 404'd URL from the app's logs/terminal and paste it into a browser, it sometimes works

I've stripped it down to the code to its bare minimum and here's the offending bit:

    $client=smugmug_instantiate();
    $repositories = $client->get('user/********!albums');
    foreach ($repositories->Album as $alb)
        {
        print "Album: ".$alb->Name."\n";
        }

Literally, if I change our account handle in the above to the name of another account, I get a list of their albums. If I put it back to ours, I get a 404. I even tried changing the name of our Smugmug account temporarily, but got the same behaviour as above with the new name.

The whole of the script I'm testing with is only 16 lines long including the above bit and the instantiate function. If I move it to a different computer on a different network with a fresh phpSmug installation, I _still_ get the same behaviour.

The actual error when run in the terminal looks like this:

```
$ php tryme.php 
PHP Fatal error:  Uncaught GuzzleHttp\Exception\ClientException: Client error: `GET https://api.smugmug.com/api/v2/user/*******!albums` resulted in a `404 Not Found` response:
{"Response":{"Uri":"/api/v2/user/********!albums","Locator":"Album","LocatorType":"Objects","UriDescription":"All of use (truncated...)
 in /tmp/smuglocal/vendor/guzzlehttp/guzzle/src/Exception/RequestException.php:113
Stack trace:
#0 /tmp/smuglocal/vendor/guzzlehttp/guzzle/src/Middleware.php(65): GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException::create(Object(GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Request), Object(GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Response))
#1 /tmp/smuglocal/vendor/guzzlehttp/promises/src/Promise.php(203): GuzzleHttp\Middleware::GuzzleHttp\{closure}(Object(GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Response))
#2 /tmp/smuglocal/vendor/guzzlehttp/promises/src/Promise.php(156): GuzzleHttp\Promise\Promise::callHandler(1, Object(GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Response), Array)
#3 /tmp/smuglocal/vendor/guzzlehttp/promises/src/TaskQueue.php(47): GuzzleHttp\Promise\Promise::GuzzleHttp\Promise\{closure}()
#4 /tmp/smuglocal/vendor/guzzl in /tmp/smuglocal/vendor/guzzlehttp/guzzle/src/Exception/RequestException.php on line 113
```


Is this at all familiar?

Many thanks,

Adrian

title: Strip empty args from url
body:
From https://github.com/lildude/phpSmug/issues/43

> When certain unusual URI queries are passed to phpSmug, we sometimes receive the following error:
>
>> PHP Notice: Undefined offset: 1 in /vendor/lildude/phpsmug/lib/phpSmug/Client.php on line 139
>
>This is caused when contiguous '&' characters appear in the query statement, effectively creating empty arguments, as seen here between arg1 and arg2:
>
>>...?arg1=value1&&arg2=value2

This PR addresses this by stripping out empty arguments as suggested in that issue.

Fixes https://github.com/lildude/phpSmug/issues/43

title: JSON encode the `_config` option for ease of use
body:
As suggested in https://github.com/lildude/phpSmug/issues/49, it would be nice if phpSmug JSON encoded the `_config` option if provided as an array. This PR implements just that.

If an array is received for `_config` it is JSON encoded for you. If a string is received, it is assumed you have already JSON encoded the configuration.

Fixes https://github.com/lildude/phpSmug/issues/49

title: Add support for "non-inline" expansions
body:
If you use the `_expand` option without setting `_expandmethod` to `inline`, SmugMug returns the expansions in their own object indexed by the expanded URI. As you can see from the example on the [expansions documentation page](https://api.smugmug.com/api/v2/doc/advanced/expansions.html), this is outside of the `Response` object.

This PR makes those expansions accessible by appending the `Expansions` object in the SmugMug response to the `Response` object so they can be accessed using `$response->Expansions->foo`.

Fixes https://github.com/lildude/phpSmug/issues/47

title: Update required PHP and dependency versions
body:
Things have moved on quite a bit since the last release of phpSmug so it's time to update the minimum requirements.

The new minimum required version of PHP is 5.6. This will change to 7.1 from January 2019 as both 5.6 and 7.0 will be out of security update support and really shouldn't be used anymore (ref http://php.net/supported-versions.php).

This PR also switches out the deprecated satooshi/php-coveralls for php-coveralls/php-coveralls.

title: Feature request: support for _config
Is this project abandoned?
body: I notice you've not merged a fairly important branch change into master, are you no longer maintaining this?

title: Problems with expansions
body:
I'm having a couple of problems with expansions in v4.

1. Since `get()` returns only the `Response` part, adding an `_expand` param doesn't seem to give any way of accessing the `Expansions` element. Should there be a `$client->getExpansions()` method? Or should any use of an `_expand` parameter silently add `_expandmethod=inline`?

1. phpSmug doesn't seem to like multiple expansions. If I do `get('user/[username]!albums?_expandmethod=inline&_expand=Node')` I get the expected response, but if I do `get('user/[username]!albums?_expandmethod=inline&_expand=Node,HighlightImage')` I don't get either URI expanded. (Same results either using $options or specifying the query string in `get()`.) Making the request from Postman does give the multiple expansion.

title: Debugging 400 response
body:
Hi,

We're upgrading to the 4.0 release, and having trouble debugging a call to create an album. We get a 400 response and the 'readable' error is such:

```
Client error: `POST https://api.smugmug.com/api/v2/folder/user/[username]!albums` resulted in a `400 Bad Request` response:
{"Options":{"Methods":["POST"],"ParameterDescription":{"Varchar":"Variable length text from MIN_CHARS to MAX_CHARS (MAX_ (truncated...)
```

I suspect something is wrong with my request, but not sure what exactly.

Does SmugMug's API provide a "Here's exactly what's wrong with your request" message that we can access, or do they just return a list of the parameters they expect at that endpoint (which is what it seems to be doing above, albeit truncated by phpSmug)?

title: Bump Guzzle version
body:
Bump minimum Guzzle version to 6.2.1 to address the httpoxy issue.

See https://github.com/guzzle/guzzle/releases/tag/6.2.1 for more details.

title: Document how to use caching middleware
body:
Thanks to using Guzzle, phpSmug doesn't need to implement it's own caching strategy.  This PR adds details to the docs giving a basic overview on how to implement caching using a middleware like [guzzle-cache-middleware](https://github.com/Kevinrob/guzzle-cache-middleware).

Fixes https://github.com/lildude/phpSmug/issues/29

title: phpSmug 4.0
body:
phpSmug 4.0 will be the first release to support the new SmugMug API 2.0.

This PR will act as my "workspace" and checklist of things to do and implement as I develop phpSmug 4.0.  If you're like to contribute, please feel free to fork this repository and submit your PRs against the phpSmug-4.0 branch.
## Todos
- [x] Change license to more liberal MIT license
- [x] Split functionality into individual files
- [x] Make tests public
- [x] Automatically run tests with Travis CI
- [x] Make composer the default installation method
- [x] PSR-0, PSR-1, PSR-2 and PSR-4 coding standards
- [x] Drop PHP 5.2 and earlier support and finally move into PHP 5.3 and later namespaces
- [x] Update examples for new implementation method
- [x] Drop socket connection support - :question:
- [x] Add a contributing.md file
- [x] Switch to Guzzle for the HTTP client so I don't need to maintain this functionality here.
- [x] Rewrite documentation and include in repository 
- [x] Proxy support

title: phpSmug 4.0
body:
# :construction: Work In Progress :construction:

phpSmug 4.0 will be the first release to support the new SmugMug API 2.0.

This PR will act as my "workspace" and checklist of things to do and implement as I develop phpSmug 4.0.  If you're like to contribute, please feel free to fork this repository and submit your PRs against the api-2.0 branch.

- [ ] Split functionality into individual files

body:
I'm attempting to pull and show images from a specific gallery and folder of galleries.  Looking at the example code in the download, how would I modify the example code to pull this?  I think this goes in tandem with the question, but how do I discover the AlbumID and AlbumKey for my galleries?

$images = $f->images_get( "AlbumID={$albums['0']['id']}", "AlbumKey={$albums['0']['Key']}", "Heavy=1" );

body:
Greetings,

I'm jumping into the space and was wondering if there is an example using phpSmug and pulling from a specific album?

title: Implement support for API 2.0
body: API 2.0 is currently open to beta testers so lets get phpSmug using it.

title: Upload results in duplicate filename
Retrieve Data While SmugMug is in Read-Only Mode
body:
According to this post http://www.dgrin.com/showthread.php?t=83918 when SmugMug is in read-only mode it is still possible to retrieve data from the API if done anonymously.

But it appears that phpSmug does not support this as I am currently receiving this error and unable to retrieve data.

title: Only flush cache if API endpoint is accessible and responsive.
body: At the moment the cache is cleared/expired before a connection is made.  phpSmug should rather keep the cache and only over-write it if the API endpoint is responsive.

title: phpSmug should provide a method that returns an OAuth signed URL for GET requests
body:
Idea from David Parry @ Smugmug...

> I took the liberty of changing one of your albums :)
> 
> I turned externals off on this galleryâ€¦ [redacted]
> 
> So requesting any of those image URLs from another web server should fail without OAuth.
> 
> The idea I had to make it the most flexible was to have a function like signResource($url), > where you pass the image URL that you want to sign and the function returns the $url with all the OAuth parameters. You can then pass that off to curl, wget or embed it in an img tag.

As I understand this, this is essentially creating a method that returns a string for GET requests with all of the OAuth params included... like Appendix A.5.3 at http://oauth.net/core/1.0/

title: Invalid tokens if page is refreshed
body: If you arrive at a page with the link to go to SmugMug and refresh it without doing anything, it fails with the error of invalid tokens. Even happens on your test page at http://phpsmug.com/examples if you hit refresh straight away.

title: I want to add Authorization Header while accesing the images
body:
Hi, 

I am getting blank images when I try to access the images using   $images = $f->images_get("AlbumID={$albums['0']['id']}", "AlbumKey={$albums['0']['Key']}", "Heavy=1"); and I am able to see the image url but it just displays the blank image and the same image url which is accessed through code can be  accessible through browser. 

When I approached the smugmug team they suggested to add the Authorization Header while accessing the images some thing like this 

This is excerpt from Oauth 1.0 soecs regarding authorization header. You should include this header, with your values naturally, to the request for images. 

5.4.1.  Authorization Header

The OAuth Protocol Parameters are sent in the Authorization header the following way:

```
Parameter names and values are encoded per Parameter Encoding.
For each parameter, the name is immediately followed by an â€˜=â€™ character (ASCII code 61), a â€˜â€â€™ character (ASCII code 34), the parameter value (MAY be empty), and another â€˜â€â€™ character (ASCII code 34).
Parameters are separated by a comma character (ASCII code 44) and OPTIONAL linear whitespace per [RFC2617].
The OPTIONAL realm parameter is added and interpreted per [RFC2617], section 1.2.
```

For example:

```
            Authorization: OAuth realm="http://sp.example.com/",
            oauth_consumer_key="0685bd9184jfhq22",
            oauth_token="ad180jjd733klru7",
            oauth_signature_method="HMAC-SHA1",
            oauth_signature="wOJIO9A2W5mFwDgiDvZbTSMK%2FPY%3D",
            oauth_timestamp="137131200",
            oauth_nonce="4572616e48616d6d65724c61686176",
            oauth_version="1.0"
```

I tried to add this my code as below and my idea is to access the images with header but it is not working. How best we can add the header 

$albums = $f->albums_get('Heavy=false');  
$sig = $f->generate_signature( 'Get', array( 'FileName' => $albums['0']['Key'] ) );
$f->setHeader( 'Authorization', 'OAuth realm="http://api.smugmug.com/",
                oauth_consumer_key="'.$f->APIKey.'",
                oauth_token="'.$f->oauth_token.'",
                oauth_signature_method="'.$f->oauth_signature_method.'",
                oauth_signature="'.urlencode( $sig ).'",
                oauth_timestamp="'.$f->oauth_timestamp.'",
                oauth_version="1.0",
                oauth_nonce="'.$f->oauth_nonce.'"' );
        // Get list of public images and other useful information
        $images = $f->images_get("AlbumID={$albums['0']['id']}", "AlbumKey={$albums['0']['Key']}", "Heavy=1");

```
Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'Exception' with message 'Unable to connect to api.smugmug.com' in phpSmug/phpSmug.php:1464 
Stack trace: 
#0 /home/public_html/phpSmug/phpSmug.php(1201): PhpSmugSocketRequestProcessor->execute('POST', 'http://api.smug...', Array, 'AlbumID=1856125...', Array)
